learning_outcomes.description: Apply conceptual frameworks underpinning aural rehabilitation of adults with acquired hearing loss
Recognize the psychosocial impact and other effects of hearing loss upon adults
Show familiarity with community services available for assisting in the aural rehabilitation of adults with hearing loss and/or communication disorders
Demonstrate understanding of the Australian government's hearing services program
Identify potential candidates for aural rehabilitation with recognition of factors that may influence success
Demonstrate an introductory understanding of hearing aid programming, including prescriptive methods
Demonstrate familiarity with the technological features of hearing aids
Select appropriate earpiece/acoustic coupling features for adults and produce earmould impressions of a manufacturable quality
Demonstrate an understanding of hearing aid verification techniques, particularly insertion gain procedures
Outline the basic technical and medical aspects of implantable devices,including post-operative management

assessments.task_description:
Students will be required to complete an overview of 12 features contained in currently available hearing aids by completing a template form located on the AUDL7823 Blackboard website (see Assessment section). The overview will address: Industry name of feature, hearing aid brand and model, technical description of feature, layperson's description of feature, your interpretation of feature, and recommended population. You may choose ANY 12 features currently available in the hearing aid market. Further, they should not all be from the same brand or model. A minimum of 4 brands is required. Choose features that you are interested in learning more about.Â 

Task requirements: Complete the template form in full. Do not alter the template form in structure, style, or font settings. References should be submitted on a separate page in APA 7th ed. format. No word limit.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This written examination will address all content presented in weeks 1-13 of the course. It will consist of short answer and case-based questions. Examples of cases are presented within lectures. Students are advised to seek and review similar examinations in this course from the UQ Library collections.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
